page.title: 10Dairy Farming
page.content: In a typical dairy farm in Cogges they make silage to feed the cows in winter. Each cow needs 9 tonnes of silage. It ismade by cutting the grass to make hay This is bundled into a huge ball and then stored until winter. The farm has a herringbone milking parlour which is computerised and can work out how much food should be given daily to each cow depending on how much milk she gives. The farmer has to be very careful to keep the milk clean. The milk is stored in a stainless steel tank which also cools it quickly. The calves are taken away from their mothers as soon as they are born. They get their mother's milk for a few days and then they feed on cattle nuts and milk powder(this is cheaper than giving them real milk). Every day the milk is collected by tanker,bottled by the Milk Marketing Board for doorstep delivery.
